Pre-Game Insights: The debut of Javier Aguirre as the head coach of Mexico will take place this weekend against New Zealand.
This match marks the beginning of a new process for Mexico leading up to the 2026 World Cup.
Mexico is considered the favorite, but recent performances suggest the match may not be straightforward.
The match could signify a generational change for the Mexican team.
Others: The match between Mexico and New Zealand will be held at the Rose Bowl on September 7, 2024.
The match will start at 19:00 hours, central Mexico time.
The match will be broadcast on Canal 5, Canal 7, TUDN, and Vix for streaming.
